Entry.1: In Cairo and to the Mousky St bazaars
Entry.12: To Bauk and then down Mousky. Send frames etc. to D.
Entry.17: Wire to Return immediately. See Col McCall and get leave extended.
Entry.18: Out to Mrs Cornish’s with Hop & Hubby.
Entry.24: Leave Ismailia on draft 9am. Catch 3.30 train to Ludd
Entry.25: Arrive Ludd 6am, leave 8am arrive Jerusalem & camp in DMC Detail Camp.
Entry.30: Arrive Talat-ed-Dumm 3am Perfect hell of a day. Move to Jehrico 7pm arrive 11PM in lovely dust & camp under Zeeb.
Entry.31: Move few yards into camp vacated by Anzac Sigs.
Entry.33:
Hot as hell and dusty. Too hot to work.

to 2nd/8th. Hot as hell. Visit W14 station for repairing.
Entry.35:
Hotter still. Feel like a piece of chewed string. Gas drill.

15/8/8 Leave camp with Bidmead to visit sets. Stay at W13 (Hanger) & get eaten by sand flies. Swimming in Jordan.
Entry.36: Overhaul set – swimming Leave for W12 (Tindale) & stay over night.
Entry.40: A perfect hell of a day with wind and dust that wrecked station & bivvies.
Entry.41: Another bad day. Prepare to move
Entry.42: 10am move out & camp on the plains. 7pm move again to Talat-ed-Dumm arriving 10.30pm. Parson’s puts horse lines down---. Bright moon.
Entry.43:
Camped all day. Go to Des Corps. 7.pm. Move on again - 
Rail 5am arrive

12-1am
Entry.44:
Camp outside Jerusalem by Jericho road. Move again. 

arrive ENAB or rather Kolonich. Camp all day. 7pm Move on. Beautiful night. Arrive Latron 1am
Entry.45:
and camp all day. 7pm move off on last trek

12 midnight arrive Ludd camp in an orchard and camp. Spend the day moving from one place to another doing silly jobs.
Entry.48: Not yet settled. Bivvies & lines moved round and round the camp. Dismantle W14 (Kaesehagen’s) Station & Shellac Condenser tubes.
Entry.49: Wonderful! Still moving the bivvies round the orchard. Men growling & cursing. A job that a boy scout could do in a few moments cannot be done by us in 4 days.
Entry.51:
Dismantle W13. held up for gear. Write stiff report 56 cases backsheesh for sqdn. 

1st- 2nd-3rd-Sept 1918. Hard at it repairing engines & instruments.

Up to
Entry.53: Go for ride by motor to Jaffa for shellac.
Entry.54: Reg Atko, Feeney, Dugdale ex Details. Rumours of stunt.
Entry.55: Leave Ludd for Jaffa. Camp till 10 am
Entry.56: Move on, water in Moving on all day
Entry.57: water at 1am & move on. Atko to 3rd Bde. Arrive Ledjun 2pm. & erect.
Entry.58:
Move on 5am to Jenin & erect (Go through Jenin with Capt Farrow & Lt Tilson)

 (Drive over hornets’ nest)
Entry.59:
Camped at Jenin

22nd Camped all day. Atko’s set out of running
Entry.60:
Move on 9am & pick up W/T gear. Arrive AFule. 3pm. Move camp again.

Lots of W/T gear in trucks on the AFule Stn.
Entry.61: Move on again 3 miles & camp in gum trees. Sprained ankle.
Entry.62: Leave Afuleh at 7 30 pm trek to Nazareth in sand & dust storm arriving midnight camp overnight in Khaffr Kemina
Entry.63: Move on 730 am to Tiberias. Erect in dust storm. Atko in. Raining during night.
Entry.64: up 3am & saddle up. Bombs Scamper out to 3rd Bde. Move 6am Halt near bridge over Jordan. Move noon and on to Kunetreh arriving 11pm.
Entry.65: Camp all day move 4pm in great rush. Bitterly cold night, fighting.
Entry.66: Arrive SASA daybreak. Pass party burying dead Aussie. Recapture 3 Aussies in hospital captured by Germans previous night wounded.
Entry.67: Fighting begins around Damascus. Heavy shelling noon Move on 1PM in small stages arrive on outskirts of city 4PM. Enemy dumps burning. Ammunition dumps exploding. Beautiful pyrotechnic display. Bad night, set out of order.
Entry.68: Move on and camp nearer city. Move again & camp near the town.
Entry.69: official entry into Damascus. Again move & camp on slope of a stony hill amongst tares & dirt. Take 6 hours to move 1 mile.
Entry.71: Move camp & take 8 hours to do 2 miles. Halt for 3 hours over 400 cholera graves. Arrive camp 5PM & a filthy hole too. Nothing but dust from the road.
Entry.73: catch the dog’s disease & feel out Go to Damascus with leave party for 2 hours
Entry.74: in bed all day feeling bad
Entry.76: Up & feeling bit better. Scores of men down with sickness.
Entry.82: goes & is sent to hospital raining all day & night.
Entry.84: Pack up and leave Damascus 10am and travel 13 miles. Camp overnight.
Entry.85: Move on again 13 miles to Kuteife & camp.
Entry.86: Revielle 4am move 26 miles to NEBK erecting half way en route.
Entry.87: Stone cold night. Move on to Hasie 24 miles pass at 8pm and at 10pm camp till 12.30am
Entry.89:
at Homs Peace with Turkey. 

Visit Reg at
Entry.90:
Bde. Go for ride through Homs with Lt Watson. See the dye industry (purple)

Great excitement over the loaded biscuit tin & a Bosch auto-Starter.

3rd Sunday. More fun with the biscuit tin. Arabs willingly give bread for this tin but can’t carry it away. Cold and cloudy.
Entry.91:
Cloudy & cold

5th Change sets with Singo. Move off at 7pm for Tripoli. Camp at midnight and
Entry.92: move off at 6am crossing the crater of an extinct volcano. Wish the big German car would smash & it did Camp in a hell of a place away from water and among boulders.
Entry.93: move again 6 am and camp 2pm on beach near Tripoli.
Entry.94: Move 8am through Tripoli camping 5 miles S & up on the hills
Entry.96: packing up curios Bum mail in.
Entry.98:
Raining all afternoon. 6pm news of armistice with Germany received with great joy. Bells, guns, dynamite sirens, rockets, fires, rifles machine guns &cat calls.

11/11/18 Feen & Simp depart for home. Atko & set in.
Entry.99: Cloudy & raining. Raining furiously all night. Bivvy leaking.
Entry.100: Mud everywhere rain. Snow on the hills
Entry.102: Go for swim with troop. Up to
Entry.104:
Hell of a storm.(OVER)

31/1/19 The Old Bush Inn Sequel called My Homestead Concert by Vibrators

Xmas & N Y Quiet

5/1/19 Leave hills for the beach at El Minah.
Entry.105: Go for swim Sea rough – raining.
Entry.107: Night out Go to Concert in Tripoli (Whizz-Bangs)
Entry.109: Races along the beach. Ginger comes
Entry.111: Jordan shot with Hector. A class horses handed over the
Entry.113: A troop technical gear returned to Ordnance (Blowing &raining for last week)
Entry.114: Last of mules & horses leave. Mules sold in Tripoli for average of £30 each. Photos of "Alice". Amuse ourselves with "Jeunafelfe", Alice & Hanna 3 Syrian kiddies.
Entry.115: Physical exercises begin rail hail & wind. Boat ashore Maj Farrow to Moascar.
Entry.117:
Embark at El Mina for Egypt by TSS Ellenga at 10am

Leave at noon. Calm sea. Lovely night.
Entry.119: Arrive Port Said at 9am disembark at 12 noon. Leave by train 2pm and arrive Moascar 5pm & move to Sig Training Unit.
Entry.120: NIL Meet Leo & others. Wind of Gippos creating disturbance in Ismailia.
Entry.121: – To Kantara per motor for sets again – Khalass alashan
Entry.122: To Kantara per rail for sets.
Entry.123: Looking under tons of rubbish at Kantara for sets.
Entry.125:
Kamseen all day - hellish hot and choking dust.

3-6-19- News of Essex. Burma Oxfordshire. Madras & Malta to take 5000 by end of June.

Inoculation against cholera.
Entry.127:
news of following boats & sailings

 Essex sailed
Entry.133:
Celebrations in Moascar

30 Peace Banquet to Zaabeta & 8th LH.
Entry.139: Hottest day in Ismailia for 18 years. 118° in shade. Peace celebrations in Ismailia
Entry.140: French Club smashed up by NZ’s & Tommies
Entry.141:
Hopes crash again. Put off indefinitely

 Bluey blasphemes the Tommy Chooooms
Entry.142: – 11th & 12th LH due to board Morvada but fire- breaks out in coal bunkers.
Entry.146: News that we sail per Burma on
Entry.148: Break camp & send gear away. Sleep a la in mess huts
Entry.149: 7am March out to train Moascar 0805 Leave for Kantara Board about 10am. Leave 1230 Arrive Suez Midnight.
Entry.150: 9 25am sail outwards. Pretty hot. Some love-birding.
Entry.153:
Cool Breezes in morning Hot in afternoon – 5 malay stokers out to it.

 P Henderson line SSBurma 8000 tons Capt Mitchell

30th 7p.m. Like hell in "the Bull Ring" (below)

Everybody feeling kark

Land appears on Port Bow Light House flashes momentarily every 6 seconds. Showers turned off.

11pm Pass L House flashing 3 successive flashes every 10 seconds. Cool during night.
Entry.154: Hot again. 11am pass Perim. Midnight Blowing & slight swell on. Soldier’s wives make a song over seasickness. Cool.
Entry.155: Swell on again .Hot as hell again. Preparing for thick weather – sails furled Thick & heavy weather 5pm.
Entry.156:
Great fun all night. Crockery ma’afis

Heave – oh! Let her go! (wifey) don’t leave me Geo!

(hubby) All right kid.

(Duet) Whoa – Burr (Overheard on boat decks)

Pass Socotra 11am. Thick & heavy sea. High wind

Atko caves in. (Mal-de-mer)

Backsheesh meals.

Cold & dark sky.
Entry.159: Smooth & warm Mungaree complaints everywhere. (Graham) Man never will have the last say unless it is to himself
Entry.160:
10am Pass very close to pretty island & l’house one Port side minicroy Island

10.45am Coolie overboard. Picked up 11.30 about done. 12.15 Full ahead again

(6/8/19) Herr Pimple entertains on the goanna endeavouring to maintain a state of perpetual motion - & received with applause
Entry.161: Land in distance on Port bow indicating mountain ranges at "South of India. 10pm arr. Colombo & moor inside bk-wter
Entry.162:
Leave ship 6am for train to Kandy. Arrive Kandy 11am – Splendid trip. Lunch in YMCA. Rickshaw round Lake then motor out to

 

Perademija Bot. Gardens. Train leaves 3pm. Arr aboard 8pm. Coaling & watering
Entry.163: Coaling & watering raining – SS Kentucky arrives. (Bucknall S. Lines) 9am. Noon sail for Fremantle. Whale on starboard bow 7pm Pass L House on Port flashes 2" – dark 23" (Pt Aghul)
Entry.165:
Burma band opens.

Boxing at night
Entry.169:
8.30am island in sight Nth Keeling Island. Fine & cool 

15th/8th/19. On which lies Emden. 9.30 Cocos Group on Starboard passing 4 miles away. Whale 20 yds from Port bow. 5pm msg from W/T Stn apologising for not seeing Burma pass & returning greetings & salute. Also outline of Emden fight.
Entry.171: Occasional raining. Bank addresses handed in to Pay Branch. Visit engine room of Burma
Entry.174:
4am bearing into Fremantle

6am moor outside. 8am. Move into wharf 10.30 am disembark WA Troops. 11am Leave granted on Pass to 2pm. 2pm aboard. 4.30 pm pass outwards (grey cheeked girl with glasses & tiny) 7 pm passing South 100 tons coal loaded.
Entry.175: Hugging land 8am pass Llewellyn LHouse Sea smooth as glass.
Entry.177:
2pm receive W/T message from home evidently sender’s name a mystery. Cameron (sgt) receives news that sister

died on 15th – this marks third case of bad news. Tich’s mother ill & Don Collins’ father killed by acid fumes.
Entry.178: Medical exam for throat trouble. Very cold Smooth
Entry.179: 12.20 pm arr Adelaide & anchor off Largs Bay. 2pm Enter outer harbour 5pm leave again. Sammy Lunn. Meet Misso on return by Persio.
Entry.180: Persio gaining on us – midday well ahead of us.
Entry.181:
7pm enter Melbourne

Heads. 11.30 tie up at Pt Melb. Alongside & at same time as Persio. Tich’s mother dead. Leave till midnight Have a good time! Return 12.30am Meet T. Kiernan on rlwy stn – address

4 Theresa St

Richmond

Or Newmaket Rwy Sub
Entry.182: 7am draw out. 11.20 drop pilot at heads W/T to Les. Alexander
Entry.183: Cool & bright due 6 am tomorrow. Arr Heads 5am
